0.title: Buffett's Berkshire buys $4.1-billion stake in chipmaker TSMC
0.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed a stake worth more than $4.1 billion in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC). Berkshire owns about 60.1 million American depositary shares of the chipmaker. It also disclosed new stakes of $297 million in building materials company Louisiana-Pacific and of $13 million in Jefferies Financial Group.

1.title: SpaceX bought a tiny ad package on Twitter for Starlink: Elon Musk
1.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has revealed that SpaceX Starlink has bought a "tiny" ad package "to test [the] effectiveness of Twitter advertising in Australia and Spain". It did the same for Facebook, Instagram and Google, he added. This comes after reports said that SpaceX had ordered "one of the larger advertising packages available from Twitter".

2.title: Adani Ports forms JV with Gadot Chemical Terminals to buy Israel's Haifa Port
2.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) announced setting up of a joint venture (JV) with Gadot Chemical Terminals in Israel, named Mediterranean International Ports ADGD Ltd. The JV will execute the acquisition of Haifa Port Company, which operates the Haifa Port in Israel. APSEZ holds a 70% stake in the JV, while the remaining will be with Gadot.

3.title: BSF jawan dies after a horse kicks him during championship practice in MP
3.article_body: A 33-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) jawan died after a horse hit him while he was practicing for an equestrian championship at BSF Academy Tekanpur in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said that during practice, a horse hit the jawan with its leg, causing a fatal head injury. He was pronounced dead after being taken to the hospital.

4.title: Germany nationalises former subsidiary of Russia's Gazprom
4.article_body: Germany has announced the nationalisation of a former subsidiary of Russian state-owned energy giant Gazprom in a bid to ensure energy security amid the war in Ukraine. The new company Securing Energy for Europe GmbH (SEFE), previously called Gazprom Germania, indirectly controls Germany's largest gas storage facility. Berlin had placed the company under its effective control back in April.

5.title: Difficult for MI to release Pollard but need to take tough calls: Harbhajan
5.article_body: Ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh commented on whether IPL franchise Mumbai Indians should retain or release all-rounder Kieron Pollard for the upcoming season. "I think it's going to be very difficult for MI to release Pollard. He has been there for many years. But yes, there are times when you have to take...tough calls," Harbhajan said.

6.title: Maha Speaker denies receiving molestation-accused MLA Awhad's resignation
6.article_body: NCP MLA Jitendra Awhad on Monday said he has tendered his resignation, condemning "false cases" registered against him, and addressed it to Maharashtra Assembly's Speaker. Awhad was booked for outraging the modesty of a female BJP leader. Speaker Rahul Narwekar, however, said Awhad didn't physically submit his resignation letter, which is required as per the rules of the House.

7.title: Farmers defamed, harassed in the name of stubble burning: Tikait
7.article_body: BKU leader Rakesh Tikait said farmers are being harassed in the name of stubble burning and commercial use norms of tractor-trolleys. "The government is defaming farmers without realising that we had no other option but to stage the 13-month-long stir," said Tikait. He added that he feared the government would 'imprison' farmers who don't buy seeds from multi-national companies.

8.title: Pet dog helps rescue owner who fainted in forest in Karnataka
8.article_body: A pet dog reportedly helped family members and villagers locate his owner after he got lost deep in a forest in Karnataka's Shivamogga district. When Shekharappa, who went to the forest to collect firewood, didn't return home, a search was launched. His dog joined the search operation hours later and found Shekharappa lying unconscious on the ground in the forest.

9.title: Russia adds 100 Canadians to its no-entry list in retaliatory move
9.article_body: Russia on Monday barred entry to 100 Canadian citizens in response to sanctions against Russians by Canada over the war in Ukraine. The Russian Foreign Ministry said that the Canadians added to its no-entry list included officials, business leaders and people involved with "media and financial structures that are directly involved in the formation of an aggressive anti-Russian course".

10.title: Centre doing nothing to control price rise of essentials: CM Mamata
10.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP-led Centre is doing nothing to check the price rise of essential commodities. "It (Centre) is only interested in using agencies against the Opposition parties. They are...using threats and intimidation tactics," CM Mamata said. She added, "The Centre is taking away all the money through GST but is not giving our (Bengal) dues."

11.title: Stay strong and protect your pride: RSS' Mohan Bhagwat to tribals
11.article_body: RSS leader Mohan Bhagwat, in Chhattisgarh, said tribal pride was India's pride and appealed to people to stand together to protect it for the country. "Some people try to dupe us by taking advantage of our innocence but we have to stay strong," said Bhagwat. Recently, the BJP alleged that religious conversion of tribals is rising in the state.

12.title: 6th seed Rublev beats 2020 champion Medvedev in Red Group in ATP Finals
12.article_body: Sixth seed Andrey Rublev beat 2020 champion Daniil Medvedev 6-7(7-9), 6-3, 7-6(9-7) in his first match of the Red Group in ATP Finals in Turin on Monday. The 25-year-old won the 37-shot rally to claim the victory on his fifth match point in the third-set tie-break. Rublev won his 50th match of the season in two hours and 31 minutes.

13.title: Verstappen refuses to help F1 teammate Perez during Brazilian GP
13.article_body: During the Brazilian Grand Prix, F1 world champion Max Verstappen refused to help teammate Sergio Perez pass him and gain points to finish second in the championship. "Yeah, it shows who he really is," said Perez during the race. Perez had helped Verstappen beat Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton to take his first title during the 2021 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

14.title: Indian smartphone market falls to 3-year low at 43 million in Q3: Report
14.article_body: India's smartphone market saw a slump of 10% year-on-year in the last quarter to 43 million units, marking the lowest third-quarter shipment since 2019, according to a report from International Data Corporation (IDC). The 5G smartphone share reached 36% of total smartphones during the reported quarter with 16 million units. The average selling price for 5G smartphones was about ₹32,000.

15.title: Shaheen Afridi advised 2-week rehab after injuring knee in T20 WC 2022 final
15.article_body: Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi has been advised two-week rehabilitation after he hurt his knee during the T20 World Cup 2022 final against England. "Discomfort was likely due to a forced knee flexion whilst landing," said PCB. Shaheen was forced to leave the field after he hurt his right knee while taking a catch in 13th over of England's innings.

16.title: PCB wasted 40 days of Shaheen's rehab by keeping him with Pak team: Sarfraz
16.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Sarfraz Nawaz criticised PCB for including pacer Shaheen Afridi in the T20 World Cup squad. "You have put Shaheen directly in WC without him playing any match since July...He shouldn't have been selected without proving it," Sarfraz said. "The PCB wasted 40 days of rehab by making a decision of keeping Shaheen with the national team," Sarfraz alleged.

17.title: 2nd India-Canada Consular Dialogue held in New Delhi
17.article_body: Indian and Canadian delegations met in New Delhi on Monday for the 2nd India-Canada Consular Dialogue which focused on improving consular, visa, and mutual legal assistance cooperation. India raised several matters, including issues related to fraudulent immigration and fake job offers, the Ministry of External Affairs informed. India also took up issues being faced by Indian students in Canada.

18.title: Kerala schools to sensitise kids about body shaming: State minister
18.article_body: Kerala Education Minister V Sivankutty called body shaming "a heinous act" and said the state government will sensitise students by including awareness programmes and lessons against it in school curriculum. In a Facebook post, he said, "There are many of us who have lost sanity being victims of body shaming." He added that a healthy discussion is needed regarding this.

19.title: Release Venkatesh, get him back at lesser price in IPL 2023 auction: Harbhajan
19.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said KKR shouldn't do an overall release of all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer in IPL 2023 auction. "You should release...and get him back at a lesser price if possible because the player is destructive. We saw a short trailer in...seven or eight matches he played," he added. Iyer was retained by KKR ahead of IPL 2022 auction for ₹8 crore.

20.title: Feared Russell wouldn't finish the Brazilian GP he won: Mercedes F1
20.article_body: Mercedes F1 said they feared driver George Russell would not finish the Brazilian Grand Prix, which he eventually won, due to a water leak. "We all agreed we're going to let him drive to the end even without water, on whatever was there to cool it," said team boss Toto Wolff. The win was Russell's maiden victory in the sport.

21.title: Some do part-time politics & full-time hypocrisy: Naqvi on Owaisi
21.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi accused AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi of "communal politics" and 'creating a divide in society'. "Some people just wear a secular sherwani (attire) and carry out communal karastani (conspiracy). They do part-time politics and full-time pakhand (hypocrisy)," said Naqvi. He added that PM Narendra Modi has never discriminated against Muslims during his tenure.

22.title: Assam working on land rights for indigenous people: CM Sarma
22.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the state is working on providing land rights to indigenous people through self-certification. He added that the self-certification will state that the claimant has been residing on the land for at least three generations without any dispute. Sarma urged the targeted beneficiaries to benefit from 'Mission Basundhara 2.0', launched for this purpose.

23.title: The next 12 months could be my last in Test cricket: David Warner
23.article_body: Australia's 36-year-old opener David Warner has said that the next 12 months could be his last in Test cricket. "I love the white-ball game...it's amazing," he stated, indicating that he'd retire from the longest format of the game first. "I will be looking to get to 2024," Warner stated, suggesting he'd like to feature in T20 World Cup 2024.

24.title: It wasn't my day today but still in competition: Nadal on loss in ATP Finals
24.article_body: Rafael Nadal took to Instagram Stories following a 6-7(3-7), 1-6 loss in his first match of Green Group in ATP Finals. "It wasn't my day today but still in competition. See you Tuesday. Once again thanks for the support Torino," he wrote. Top-seeded Nadal will face Canada's Felix Auger-Aliassime, who was beaten by Norwegian Casper Ruud, in his second match.

25.title: Tiger Global Management offloads PB Fintech shares worth ₹522.50 crore
25.article_body: Tiger Global Management has offloaded shares amounting to a 2.98 per cent stake in Policybazaar's parent firm PB Fintech for ₹522.50 crore through open market transactions. According to data from the NSE, funds managed by Tiger Global have sold a total of 1,34,17,607 shares. The shares were disposed of at an average price of ₹389.38-₹389.44 apiece.

26.title: Gujarat HC likely to hear suo motu PIL on Morbi tragedy tomorrow
26.article_body: The Gujarat High Court is likely to hear the suo motu PIL on the Morbi bridge tragedy on Tuesday. The matter was not taken up on Monday due to the unavailability of the bench headed by Chief Justice Aravind Kumar. The division bench, on November 7, had issued a notice to the state government and sought a status report.

27.title: Late actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's daughter pens note for him, shares old pics
27.article_body: Late actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi's daughter Diza took to Instagram to pen a note following Siddhaanth's demise. Sharing old pictures, she wrote, "It still hasn't sunk in...I still don't know how to react." "You were always my best friend first and heard all my problems, advised me in boy issues...threatened to kill half the male population," she wrote.

28.title: As a kid, I had a hole in my heart: TV actress Niti Taylor
28.article_body: TV actress Niti Taylor has revealed that as a kid, she had a hole in her heart. She added, "There were many things...I wasn't allowed to do including dance because it could jeopardise my health. I couldn't go to amusement parks or take flights or do anything remotely adventurous." "When I recovered, I danced with joy," said Niti.

29.title: I'll work & sleep in Twitter's headquarters until the company is fixed: Musk
29.article_body: The world's richest man and Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Monday tweeted that he had been at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters "all night". He added, "Will be working & sleeping here until org (organisation) is fixed," he added. Earlier, Musk complained that Twitter's Android app is too slow.

30.title: Over 1,000 cheated in pan-India online Ola scooty scam, 16 arrested
30.article_body: Delhi Police's Cyber Crime Unit on Monday busted an online pan-India Ola electric scooty scam in which over 1,000 people have been cheated. At least 16 people have been arrested in the case from various parts of the country, DCP (Outer North) Devesh Mahla said. According to him, 114 SIM cards, over 60 cellphones and seven laptops have been seized.

31.title: Shraddha told us Aftab fights with her & beats her up: Shraddha's father
31.article_body: Shraddha Walkar, the woman who was killed and whose corpse were dismembered by her live-in partner Aftab in Delhi, had told her parents about suffering physical abuse. "My daughter would tell her mother that Aftab quarrels with her and beats her up," said her father Vikas Walkar in the FIR. Shraddha had spoken to him about it too, he said.

32.title: Hindi version of 'Kantara' collects ₹75.95 crore at box office
32.article_body: The Hindi version of the Kannada film 'Kantara' collected ₹75.95 crore at the box office till Sunday. The Hindi version of the film, which was directed and written by Rishab Shetty, had released on October 14. The Hindi version of the film collected ₹1.27 crore on day one. The Kannada film also featured actress Sapthami Gowda and actor Kishore.

33.title: L&T, Mindtree get merger approval, to be India's 5th largest IT firm
33.article_body: L&T Infotech and Mindtree received approval for a merger by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The combined entity will become LTIMindtree and will be India's fifth-largest IT provider by market capitalisation and sixth-largest by revenue. L&T Group Chairman AM Naik said that LTIMindtree along with L&T Technology Services (LTTS), will generate $5.6 billion in revenue this year.

34.title: 'Raksha Bandhan' actress Sadia to star in John's 'The Diplomat': Reports
34.article_body: Actress Sadia Khateeb, who was seen in the film 'Raksha Bandhan', has reportedly bagged a part in 'The Diplomat', an upcoming film which stars John Abraham. 'The Diplomat', which went on floors a few days back in Chandigarh, is being directed by Shivam Nair of 'Special OPS' and 'Naam Shabana' fame, according to reports.

35.title: If something happens to Shaheen, where will you find another like him: Javed
35.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed commented after pacer Shaheen Afridi got injured in the middle of the T20 World Cup final against England on Sunday. "Shaheen wasn't fit enough to play...He is important but the WC will come again after 2 years. If something happens to Shaheen, how are you going to bring another bowler like him?" Javed asked.

36.title: NCW seeks detailed report from Delhi Police on Shraddha murder case
36.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has asked for a detailed report from Delhi Police on the Shraddha murder case. "Proper investigation should be done and exemplary punishment must be given to avert such incidents in future," the commission said. Shraddha was allegedly killed by her live-in partner Aftab Ameen Poonawalla. Her body was chopped into 35 pieces in Delhi.

37.title: 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' makers planning to release film in 2024: Report
37.article_body: The makers of 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' are planning to release the film in early 2024, according to a report. "Sukumar's (director) perfection will lead to a delay in the film's release...He doesn't want to rush to complete...shoot and hence, the makers, for now, have decided to release Pushpa 2...in March-April 2024," a source was quoted as saying.

38.title: Aamir to not act in 'Champions', says 'Will approach other actors'
38.article_body: Aamir Khan, who was set to star in the upcoming film 'Champions', revealed that he will now produce the film. He has decided to take a break from acting in order to spend more time with his family. "I'll be approaching other actors now to do the role...I was hoping to do...Hopefully, that will go well," Aamir said about 'Champions'.

39.title: CIA chief to warn Russian counterpart against nuke use: Report
39.article_body: CIA Director William Burns on Monday will caution the head of Russian external intelligence agency SVR about the "consequences of the use of nuclear weapons by Russia", a White House spokesperson said, AP reported. Burns won't hold negotiations over the Ukraine war, the spokesperson added, speaking on condition of anonymity. The spokesperson said the meeting would take place in Ankara.

40.title: Centre ready to bring fuel under GST but states won't agree: Puri
40.article_body: Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said the Centre is ready to bring petrol and diesel under the GST but the state governments are unlikely to agree. "They (states) get revenue out of this. One who is getting revenue, why would he leave it?" said Puri. He added that India insulated itself from the rising fuel prices by reducing excise duty.

41.title: This kid is special: Yuvraj on 18-yr-old Garnacho's late-winner vs Fulham
41.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to praise Alejandro Garnacho after the 18-year-old scored his first goal in Premier League to hand Manchester United a last-minute win over Fulham on Sunday. "Unittedddd!!!!! What a win...Garnacho, this kid is special!!! Man of the Match," he wrote. Manchester United won 2-1. It was Garnacho's first goal in three Premier League appearances this season.

42.title: Hyderabad man who murdered wife over dowry in 2014 jailed for life
42.article_body: A Hyderabad man was sentenced to life imprisonment by a local court for murdering his wife over dowry in 2014. The accused, identified as Pidugu Sudhakar, married the deceased in 2011 and, over time, started harassing her for more dowry and even suspected her fidelity. In a fit of rage, he doused her with kerosene and set her on fire.

43.title: Hardik should be India's captain in T20 World Cup 2024: Srikkanth
43.article_body: Ex-Chairman Kris Srikkanth said if he were the Chairman of BCCI's selection committee then he'd appoint Hardik Pandya as India's captain for T20 World Cup 2024. "And start rebuilding a side right from today, that's from...New Zealand series which is going to happen in a weeks' time," he added. Hardik will lead India in upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

44.title: Sexual intention key aspect to filing case under POCSO: Gujarat HC
44.article_body: The Gujarat HC set aside proceedings initiated under the POCSO Act against a school principal, teacher and others citing lack of "sexual intention". The bench said that the offence should be committed to further the accused's "sexual intention". The victim's mother had alleged that the school principal and teachers threatened to leak a video of the girl adjusting her skirt.

45.title: People of Gujarat shouldn't waste their votes on Congress: Kejriwal
45.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said the people of Gujarat should not "waste their votes" on the Congress as his party was the one in direct contest with the ruling BJP. "They (voters) should vote for the AAP, which is offering hope to your children and your family," said Kejriwal. He further claimed that Congress will only get four-five seats.

46.title: 4 University of Idaho students found dead; homicide probe launched
46.article_body: Police in the US state of Idaho opened a homicide investigation into the death of four University of Idaho students whose bodies were discovered in a house near the university campus. The incident prompted the university to order its students and staff to shelter in place and avoid the area. The alert was lifted about three hours later.

47.title: Amazon plans to lay off nearly 10,000 employees starting this week: Reports
47.article_body: Amazon plans to lay off nearly 10,000 employees beginning this week, The New York Times reported citing people aware of the matter. It would be the largest job cut in Amazon's history, the report said. The layoffs would represent less than 1% of Amazon's global workforce and would focus on the company's devices organisation, retail division and human resources.

48.title: Indian women sing 'Chitthi Aayi Hai' while welcoming PM Modi in Bali, video surfaces
48.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday arrived in Indonesia's Bali for the 17th G20 Leaders' Summit. In a video that has surfaced online, women from Indian community in Bali can be heard singing 'Chitthi Aayi Hai' song while welcoming PM Modi. PM Modi also shared pictures on Twitter following his arrival in Bali.

49.title: Pandit Nehru’s book to be given out as Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes
49.article_body: The Bharat Jodo Yatra entered its 68th day as it resumed from Kalamnuri in Maharashtra's Hingoli district after a one-day break. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said 600 copies of Jawaharlal Nehru's book 'Discovery of India' will be distributed to celebrate the former PM's birth anniversary. "Nehru continues to inspire and his relevance has only increased after 2014," said Ramesh.

50.title: POCSO not meant to criminalise consensual relations: Delhi HC
50.article_body: The Delhi High Court said the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act was "never meant to criminalise consensual relations between young adults". The court was granting bail to a man arrested under the POCSO Act after marrying a 17-year-old girl. The court observed that a consensual relationship borne out of love should be of consideration while granting bail.

51.title: Musk responds with single-word tweet 'No' to tycoon Legere's offer to run Twitter
51.article_body: John Legere, the former CEO of US telecom major T-Mobile, offered to run Twitter by tweeting, "Hi Elon Musk, maybe I should run Twitter...I'm expensive but so is what you paid for Twitter." Musk responded to Legere's offer with a single-word tweet, "No". Legere later tweeted, "Well that was a short interview...fair enough...Can't say I didn't try."

52.title: 'Adipurush' makers to shave off Saif's beard in film after criticism: Reports
52.article_body: The makers of 'Adipurush' have decided to shave off Saif Ali Khan's beard digitally in the film, according to reports. Following the release of the film's teaser, many on social media compared Saif's look as Raavan to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. The release date of the film has also been postponed from January 12 to June 16.

53.title: Akshay's character in 'Hera...' dropped, Kartik to play new character: Reports
53.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan won't be replacing Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri 3', as per reports. He'll be introduced as a new character in the third instalment as Akshay's character Raju has been dropped, reports said. Akshay recently confirmed his exit from the film, saying he wasn't satisfied with the script. The upcoming film will reportedly be directed by Anees Bazmee.

54.title: After 12 hrs of 'RRR' shoot, Jr NTR rehearsed dance for 2-3 hrs: Rajamouli
54.article_body: 'RRR' filmmaker SS Rajamouli called actor Jr NTR a "fantastic dancer". "Every day, after 12 hours of [RRR's] shoot, Jr NTR used to go back and rehearse for another 2-3 hours each day for the next day's shot, which was recorded in 15 days," he added. The film also featured actor Ram Charan and actress Alia Bhatt.

55.title: He isn't in T20I or ODI team: Sehwag on Shaw ahead of white-ball series vs NZ
55.article_body: Virender Sehwag said he wanted to see batter Prithvi Shaw's name in India's 16-member squad for upcoming white-ball series against New Zealand. "He isn't in...T20I or...ODI team. He hasn't been there in Tests for a long time. I want to see him back," he added. "Shaw plays at 150 strike rate in...top order, he's suitable for T20 cricket," Sehwag stated.

56.title: 11 RSS workers sentenced to life imprisonment in 2013 murder case
56.article_body: A sessions court in Kerala on Monday sentenced 11 RSS workers to life imprisonment for the murder of a man named Anavoor Narayanan Nair. Neyyattinkara Additional Sessions Judge Kavitha Gangadharan, who sentenced the 11 to life term, imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh each on three of the accused. Nair was hacked to death by the RSS workers in 2013.

57.title: No layoffs planned, but will freeze hiring: LinkedIn CEO
57.article_body: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky said that they are not planning layoffs but there will be a hiring freeze across some parts of the company soon. "Like every other leader, we're just continuing to navigate the global strategy that we need to keep the company going to create this platform," said Roslansky. He added that layoffs come with their own problems.

58.title: Adani gets SEBI's nod for open offer for stake in NDTV
58.article_body: The Adani Group has received SEBI's approval to float an open offer for a further 26% stake in NDTV, allowing Adani to buy more equity from the media firm’s minority shareholders. The conglomerate had revised the offer’s roll out date to November 22. It will close on December 5, NDTV said last week.

59.title: Apple search engine faces delay as top talent moves to Google: Report
59.article_body: Apple's search technology is reportedly facing a setback in the development of its search engine as the company has lost its top talent to Google. According to a report by The Information, all those employees were the founders of Laserlike. Apple had acquired the company in 2018 hoping to improve the search functionality of Siri and Spotlight.

60.title: Don't fall for caste, class differences: AAP's Gadhvi to voters
60.article_body: AAP's CM candidate for Gujarat Assembly polls, Isudan Gadhvi urged voters not to fall for caste, class and community differences. "Revolution will come on December 8. I have no political background...It was because these people did not work...that I had to come into politics," Gadhvi said after filing his nomination to contest from Khambhalia.

61.title: German Parliament blocks reform plan for unemployment benefits scheme
61.article_body: Germany's upper house of parliament on Monday blocked a proposed reform to the country's unemployment benefits system, a central policy of Chancellor Olaf Scholz's government. His three-party alliance doesn't have a majority in the upper house. Germany's main centre-right opposition bloc opposes the overhaul, arguing that it would reduce pressure and incentives for people to take available jobs.

62.title: Aditya Birla Capital, Nippon Life merger talks break down: Report
62.article_body: Talks between Aditya Birla Capital and Nippon Life to merge Birla Sun Life and Reliance Nippon Life Insurance Company (RNLIC) have reportedly collapsed as Nippon did not agree to a reduced stake in RNLIC. Nippon Life's stake would have fallen below 10% from 49% following the merger. RNLIC is a subsidiary of Reliance Capital, which is undergoing insolvency resolution process.

63.title: People sorry for boycotting 'Laal...' should've given ₹500 to makers: Manav
63.article_body: Actor Manav Vij has said that Twitter users apologised to him because they boycotted his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' in theatres but loved the Aamir Khan-starrer on the OTT platform. "I said, 'If you were so apologetic, you should've transferred ₹500 to Aamir Khan Productions' account. The producers are at a loss because of your stupidity'," he added.

64.title: India lost $7.6 billion due to floods, storms in 2021: WMO report
64.article_body: India may have lost $4.4 billion due to storms and an additional $3.2 billion due to flooding in 2021, the World Meteorological Organisation (WMO) said in a report. China lost $18.4 billion due to flooding, the highest in Asia. Annual investment in adaptation would need to be highest for China ($188.8 billion), followed by India ($46.3 billion), the report added.

65.title: 5 injured in clash between groups over social media post in K'taka
65.article_body: Five persons have been injured in a clash between two groups in Karnataka's Shivamogga district, according to police. As per reports, a dispute between two persons over a comment in response to a social media post turned into a clash between their supporters on Sunday evening. Police added that no communal angle was found behind the clash.

66.title: Man's body found 4 yrs after his wife & her lover killed & buried him in home in UP
66.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested after the skeletal remains of the woman's husband were found in a 6-foot-deep pit in her lover's home in UP's Ghaziabad on Monday, police said. Arun, who had an affair with his neighbour Savita, allegedly killed her husband Chandravir, buried him in the pit and covered it with cement in 2018.

67.title: Will hang Kasab but worship Abdul Kalam: BJP's Guj polls candidate
67.article_body: BJP's candidate from the Muslim-dominated Mandvi seat in Kutch, Aniruddh Dave, on Monday said that he is against Ajmal Kasab and will hang him, but will build temples for the worship of Abdul Kalam. Speaking at an election gathering in the Mandvi Assembly constituency, Dave described himself as a "Brahmin" and said that there's no opposition against any religion.

68.title: MP doubles ex-gratia in cases of deaths by wild animals to ₹8 lakh
68.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has doubled the ex-gratia in cases of people killed in attacks by wild animals from ₹4 lakh to ₹8 lakh. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "In some unfortunate incidents of attacks on human beings by wild animals, some people lose their lives, and it is our endeavour that such incidents don't take place."

69.title: I won't be working as an actor for the next year, year and a half: Aamir Khan
69.article_body: Actor-producer Aamir Khan has said that he won't be working as an actor for the next year, year and a half. "I want to take a break. I want to be with my family," he added. "For the last 35 years, I have single-mindedly been focussed on my work...It's not fair to people who are close to me," Aamir stated.

70.title: Man Utd issue statement after Ronaldo claims that he is being forced out of the club
70.article_body: Manchester United have issued statement after Cristiano Ronaldo claimed in an interview that he is being forced out of the club. "The club will consider its response after...full facts have been established. Our focus remains on preparing for...second half of the season and continuing...momentum, belief & togetherness being built among the players, manager, staff and fans," the statement read.

71.title: List of 25 sportspersons who will be honoured with Arjuna Award 2022 released
71.article_body: The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports today released a list of 25 sportspersons, who'll be honoured with Arjuna Award 2022 on November 30 by President Droupadi Murmu. The winners include two boxers, two badminton players, two chess players, two wrestlers and two shooters, among others. Weightlifter Vikas Thakur and kabaddi player Sakshi Kumari have also been included.

72.title: Aftab read about human anatomy after murdering Shraddha to dispose of body
72.article_body: Aftab Poonawalla, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, read about blood-cleaning methods and human anatomy online after the murder, Delhi Police said. Aftab told police that he read about human anatomy so that it could help him in chopping off the body. Aftab and Shraddha had eloped from Mumbai to Delhi.

73.title: Centre's air quality panel lifts ban on construction activity in Delhi
73.article_body: Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has lifted stage 3 measures under the Graded Response Action Plan as Delhi's air quality index (AQI) improved to 'poor' category. With this, private construction and demolition activities can resume in Delhi. Improvement in AQI is likely to sustain and the situation will be reviewed in a meeting on November 18, CAQM said.

74.title: India cricket will gain nothing by retaining Rohit as captain: Ex-player
74.article_body: Former India pacer Atul Wassan said that Indian cricket will not gain anything by retaining Rohit Sharma as the skipper of the T20 side. "Team management was taking all decisions. Rohit did not take a single call. He only decided where to hide...[Currently,] you have two options in front of you – Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant," Wassan said.

75.title: Taiwan issue is the 'red line' that must not be crossed: China's Xi to US Prez
75.article_body: In his first face-to-face meeting with US President Joe Biden in Indonesia, Chinese President Xi Jinping said that the Taiwan issue is "at the very core of China's core interests". It is also the "first red line that must not be crossed in China-US relations", Xi Jinping said. Biden raised objections over China's "coercive" and "increasingly aggressive" actions towards Taiwan.

76.title: SRK liked 'Drona', wrote a beautiful letter to me after its premiere: Abhishek
76.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said in an interview that Shah Rukh Khan liked his 2008 movie 'Drona'. "Shah Rukh came to...premiere and he wrote me the sweetest letter, that very night, he went home and wrote me a letter about how much he enjoyed [it]," he said, adding, "He said we need to start pushing boundaries; he wrote a beautiful letter."

77.title: Aamir was a father figure on 'Taare...' set, but I was scared of him: Darsheel
77.article_body: 'Taare Zameen Par' actor Darsheel Safary, speaking about working with Aamir Khan, said, "He was...like a father figure on set." He added, "I was also scared of him because I was like if I go slightly out of the way...I'm going to get...a shouting. But I never got shouted at." Darsheel further said he used to play chess with Aamir.

78.title: Guj Cong leader among 345 infected with food poisoning after event
78.article_body: Over 345 people, including Gujarat Congress leader Suleman Patel, were infected with food poisoning after attending a religious gathering in Bharuch on Sunday. The Congress leader was discharged on Monday, while two children are currently undergoing treatment. People complained of vomiting, diarrhoea and stomach ache after having food at the event.

79.title: Ankush Saigal appointed as Wipro's Telecom Head for Southeast Asia
79.article_body: Wipro has announced Ankush Saigal as its telecom industry sector head in Southeast Asia to lead the company's business growth for the region. Prior to joining Wipro, Saigal worked with Accenture, expanding technology sales across industry, driving go-to-market with key ecosystem partners and managing client relationships. Saigal has also worked with Infosys, managing business relationships.

80.title: Attached clips to hip to recreate gunshot pain for 'Lootera': Ranveer
80.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that he tried to recreate a gunshot-level pain for his 2013 film 'Lootera'. "I used to take these very industrial-grade clips and clip them to my hip in the morning," he stated. "When they said, roll camera, I'd hit it...[the] pain would go from the tip of my toe to my hip," the actor added.

81.title: India have a chance to win hockey WC 2023: Ex-Olympic medallist
81.article_body: Ex-Olympic silver medallist Juan Escarre said that India have a chance to win the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in Bhubaneswar. "Belgium, Australia and you will always find a very good German team...And, the Netherlands and Spain as well. But, you never know, anything is possible in this kind of tournament," Escarre said.

82.title: K'taka BJP leader arrested over threat to Mallikarjun Kharge's son
82.article_body: Karnataka BJP leader Manikanth Rathod was on Sunday arrested for issuing a death threat to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's son and MLA Priyank Kharge. However, he was released on bail later. Rathod had threatened Priyank Kharge after he lashed out at BJP workers over a campaign against him in Chittapur on November 8.

83.title: Congress workers vandalise party office over candidate selection for Guj polls
83.article_body: Congress workers from Jamalpur-Khadia and Vatva in Ahmedabad vandalised the party headquarters to protest against candidate selection for Gujarat Assembly polls. Protestors alleged that MLA Imran Khedawala, Congress' candidate for Jamalpur-Khadia seat, is connected with local real-estate lobby and will lose the polls. A video of the incident showed workers defacing walls and writing slogans.

84.title: 12 labourers feared trapped after stone quarry collapses in Mizoram
84.article_body: At least a dozen labourers from Bihar are feared trapped after a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram on Monday. As per reports, the incident took place when the labourers, who were working in the area, had returned from their lunch break. State Disaster Response Force, Border Security Force (BSF) and Assam Rifles have been deployed to assist in rescue operations.

85.title: Shaheen's injury not a factor, Pak was 15-20 runs short: Gavaskar
85.article_body: Ex-Indian skipper Sunil Gavaskar said that he doesn't think that pacer Shaheen Afridi's injury in the middle of the T20 World Cup final cost Pakistan the match. "Pakistan were around 15-20 runs short...I don't think the 10 deliveries that Shaheen didn't bowl would have made...difference. Maybe Pakistan would have got another wicket, but England would still have won," Gavaskar said.

86.title: Iran strikes Kurdish outfit's HQ in Iraq; 2 killed, 10 injured
86.article_body: Two people were killed and 10 were injured on Monday after an Iranian Kurdish party's headquarters in Iraq's Koye city was hit by rockets and drones, officials said. Iranian state media said the country's Revolutionary Guards had attacked the bases of "terrorist groups" in Iraq's autonomous Kurdish region. Tehran blames Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups for the ongoing unrest in Iran.

87.title: Sharath Kamal Achanta to be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022
87.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal Achanta will be conferred with Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award 2022. He will receive the award from President Droupadi Murmu on November 30 in a ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan. Sharath Kamal bagged three gold medals at Commonwealth Games in Birmingham earlier this year.

88.title: Narrated 'Salaam Venky' to Aamir Khan, he said 'Won't change a word': Director
88.article_body: Filmmaker Revathy opened up about how actor Aamir Khan agreed to be a part of her upcoming film 'Salaam Venky', which also features Kajol. She stated, "Aamir said he just wanted to read his scenes...It was just over the phone. Then we had a film narration...Aamir said, 'I won't change a single word, I'll just do the film'."

89.title: Musk scolds Android engineer on Twitter, asks 'What have you done to fix the app?'
89.article_body: Elon Musk publicly scolded Twitter app's Android engineer Eric Frohnhoefer and tweeted, "Twitter is super slow on Android. What have you done to fix that?" Musk tweeted this after Eric contended Musk's claim of Twitter being "super slow" in many countries. "I have spent 6 years working on Twitter for Android and can say this is wrong," Eric had said.

90.title: US Prez opposes China's 'aggressive acts' on Taiwan in 1st meet with Chinese Prez
90.article_body: US President Joe Biden met with Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first time since assuming office amid tensions over Taiwan. The meeting took place on the sidelines of the G20 Summit in Indonesia's Bali and Biden raised concerns about China's human rights record, the White House said. He also objected to China's "coercive and increasingly aggressive actions toward Taiwan".

91.title: Pakistan fought valiantly vs England in T20 WC 2022 final: Bangar
91.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said Pakistan fought "valiantly" in the T20 World Cup 2022 final as having a score of 137 was never going to be enough against the lineup that England possessed. Put to bat first, Pakistan managed to score 137/8 in 20 overs. England chased the target in 19 overs. They won by five wickets.

92.title: Electric mobility startup Yulu raises $9 mn via debt-financing
92.article_body: Electric mobility startup Yulu raised $9 million in funding from US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) through debt-financing. The Bengaluru-based firm was founded in 2017 by RK Misra, Naveen Dachuri, Hemant Gupta and Amit Gupta and provides urban mobility supported by AI-powered battery. In September, Yulu raised $82 million in a funding round led by Canada's Magna International.

93.title: Ex-Army man run over by truck while trying to avoid pothole in K'taka
93.article_body: A retired Indian Army soldier, on a two-wheeler, was killed after he was run over by a truck while trying to avoid a pothole in Karnataka's Mandya district. Police said the truck was seized following the accident and a case was lodged. Former CM and Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised the state government over poor condition of roads.

94.title: Zomato to shut down UAE app on November 24
94.article_body: Zomato announced that it will discontinue its application in the United Arab Emirates on November 24, according to a regulatory filing. Customers looking to order food through the Zomato app in UAE will be redirected to Talabat, the filing added. Zomato sold its UAE food delivery business to Talabat in 2019 for $172 million.

95.title: SEBI proposes mandating top 250 listed firms to confirm or deny media reports
95.article_body: SEBI has proposed mandating the top 250 listed companies to confirm or deny any information reported in the mainstream media, which may have a material effect on the listed entity, to streamline the disclosure requirements. SEBI has also suggested reducing the timeline to 12 hours from the occurrence of events or information for making disclosure to the stock exchanges.

96.title: Wife, brother arrested for murdering 35-year-old man in Ghaziabad
96.article_body: A day after a 35-year-old man was found murdered at his house in Ghaziabad's Loni, the local police arrested his wife and the victim's younger brother for the alleged murder. The accused, Sazra Khatoon (32) and Mohammad Amir (21), allegedly murdered the victim, Ayaz Ahmad, as they were in a relationship which was objected by the victim, police said.

97.title: 35-yr-old man, 5 dogs electrocuted to death near farm in Tamil Nadu
97.article_body: A 35-year-old man and five of his dogs were electrocuted to death when they came in contact with an illegal electric fence near a farm in Tamil Nadu's Madurai district. According to police, the deceased and two of his friends had gone hunting for hares on Saturday night when the incident took place.

98.title: Zomato Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo resigns
98.article_body: Zomato's Head of New Businesses Rahul Ganjoo has resigned from the company after five years, according to a regulatory filing. He joined Zomato in 2017 as the head of product development and assumed the title of Head of New Businesses in August this year. Zomato reported a consolidated net loss of ₹250.8 crore in the quarter ended September.

99.title: Delhi restaurants allowed to serve food in open spaces, terraces
99.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has eased licencing norms for restaurants to use open spaces and terraces for serving food. According to an official document, eateries following certain restrictions will not require an additional fire no-objection certificate (NOC) for using such spaces. No cooking or preparation of eatables is allowed in any part of the open space or terrace.

100.title: Drunk driver rams car onto footpath in Pune, 3 people injured
100.article_body: A real estate dealer who was driving under the influence of alcohol rammed his car onto a footpath in Pune's Wakad area. The driver of the car, Harsh Mohan Singh, hit three people who were walking back home. One of the injured was dragged for a certain distance by the car and sustained head injuries. The police have booked Singh.

101.title: Relationship with SRK, Anil Kapoor has not changed: Subhash Ghai
101.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai has said that his relationship with Shah Rukh Khan and Anil Kapoor has not changed. He further added that Jackie Shroff, Sanjay Dutt, Madhuri Dixit and Mahima Chaudhry are still his friends and they still meet. "I went to Anil's house the day before yesterday. We drank and shared our experience," Subhash further stated.

102.title: 62 migrants rescued from sailboat in Aegean Sea: Greek Coast Guard
102.article_body: A cargo ship rescued 62 migrants from a sailboat taking on water in the eastern Aegean Sea, the Greek Coast Guard said. The survivors were later transferred to a coast guard lifeboat. The coast guard said it had launched a search and rescue operation following a distress call in the early hours of Monday about a vessel in rough seas.

103.title: If you want to become heroes, lift 2023 WC title at Wankhede: Akhtar to Pak
103.article_body: Motivating Pakistan after their five-wicket loss in T20 World Cup 2022 final, Shoaib Akhtar said, "If you want to become heroes, lift the World Cup [2023] trophy at Wankhede Stadium. This is a challenge for you. Go and get fit." Akhtar praised Pakistan, saying, "Well done Pakistan...Playing the World Cup final is not a small achievement."

104.title: SC refuses to stay proceedings in Delhi riots case against Tahir Hussain
104.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to stay proceedings against former AAP Councillor Tahir Hussain over cases registered against him for the 2020 northeast Delhi riots. The bench said it is not inclined to interfere with the Delhi High Court's September 16 interim order and all remedies are open to the petitioner. Hussain has been in judicial custody since March 16, 2020.

105.title: Mumbai gym trainer molests woman, threatens to kidnap her daughter
105.article_body: A 29-year-old gym trainer was arrested for molesting a woman and threatening to kidnap her daughter if she refused to meet him, reports said. The victim said that the accused took her number to place orders for vada pav, on which he called multiple times. Denying such claims, the accused's lawyer said that the two shared pictures on social media.

106.title: Mumbai student aims to make city police stations more eco-friendly
106.article_body: Joint Commissioner (Law and Order) of Mumbai Police, Vishwas Nangre Patil, recently interacted with a young student who had put together a presentation on how to make police stations more environment-friendly. The student's plan included the introduction of air-purifying local plants and making stations plastic-free. His plans included having a more sophisticated water and waste management system.

107.title: Hyd boy asks KTR for municipal water on Children's Day, he responds
107.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a boy from Hyderabad asked Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) for municipal water on Children's Day. KTR responded to the video and asked Dana Kishore, Managing Director, Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), to visit the place and resolve the issue. "Yes sir. Will inspect," Kishore responded.

108.title: Actor Sunil Shende passes away at 75
108.article_body: Actor Sunil Shende, who appeared in shows and movies like 'Circus', 'Shanti' and 'Sarfarosh', passed away at 75 at his Mumbai residence on Monday. The cause of death of Shende, who appeared in movies such as 'Gandhi', 'Ghayaal', 'Ziddi', 'Daud', and 'Viruddh', was not immediately known. "Great actor and a great human being," his 'Shanti' co-star Rajesh Tailang tweeted.

109.title: New portrait of King Charles released to celebrate his first birthday as monarch
109.article_body: A portrait has been released to mark the birthday of King Charles, who turned 74 today. The image shows him leaning against an ancient oak tree in Windsor. Buckingham Palace announced he's taking on role of The Ranger of Windsor Great Park, a post previously held by his father, Prince Philip. This is King Charles' first birthday since becoming monarch.

110.title: Neither of us has felt it: Arbaaz on 22-yr age gap with girlfriend Giorgia
110.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Arbaaz Khan in an interview addressed the 22-year age gap between him and his girlfriend-model Giorgia Andriani. "There's a humongous age difference between us, but neither of us has felt it," he said. Arbaaz further said that Giorgia is a wonderful girl, adding, "She has that...exuberance in her, that energy in her...I draw energy from her sometimes."

111.title: IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi appointed new CEO of Prasar Bharati
111.article_body: Senior IAS officer Gaurav Dwivedi has been appointed the CEO of state broadcaster Prasar Bharati. He will serve in the office for a period of five years, the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting said in a statement on Monday. He is currently posted as Chief Executive Officer, MyGov, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology.

112.title: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Griswold accused of raping teammate
112.article_body: US' Paralympic gold medal-winning swimmer Robert Griswold, 25, has been accused of raping and abusing his 19-year-old teammate Parker Egbert. As per a lawsuit, Griswold allegedly "maliciously targeted" Parker during Tokyo Paralympics last year and at the US Olympic & Paralympic Training Center in Colorado. "This case is a horrific tragedy," the lawsuit further stated.

113.title: I'll donate majority of my $124 bn wealth: World's 4th richest man Jeff Bezos
113.article_body: Amazon Founder and the world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos has said that he will donate the majority of his $124 billion wealth in his lifetime. "The hard part is figuring out how to do it in a levered way," Bezos said. "It's not easy...There are a bunch of ways that I think you could do ineffective things, too," he added.

114.title: Major highways closed, villages cut off after snowfall, rain in J&K
114.article_body: Major highways were closed and villages in high-altitude areas were cut off due to heavy overnight snowfall and rains in Jammu and Kashmir. As a precautionary measure, authorities closed schools in some districts on Monday. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the minimum temperature in the valley can reach up to minus 3 degree Celsius on Monday.

115.title: DCW chief issues notice to Delhi Police over Shraddha murder case
115.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal has issued a notice to the Delhi Police and taken "suo-moto cognizance" of the murder of a woman, Shraddha, in Mehrauli. The notice directs police to provide various information and documents, including a copy of the FIR registered in the case and details of the action taken report in the matter.

116.title: Delhi bus driver suffers epileptic fit, rams bus into auto; 1 killed
116.article_body: A 49-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was killed after a bus rammed into his vehicle in Delhi's Civil Lines. The incident took place on Sunday morning when a 37-year-old bus driver suffered an epileptic fit and lost control of the vehicle. The accused has been arrested and booked for rash driving and causing death by negligence.

117.title: I'm sorry: CM Mamata after Bengal minister says 'how does our President look?'
117.article_body: Reacting to West Bengal minister Akhil Giri's remarks on President Droupadi Murmu, CM Mamata Banerjee said, "I am sorry, I do apologise on behalf of the party (Trinamool Congress)." Giri courted controversy by saying, "We don't judge anyone by their appearance...but how does our President look?" Mamata condemned his remark, saying, "Beauty can't be decided by external looks."

118.title: It's a myth when people say eat for two during pregnancy: Sonam
118.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, who welcomed a baby boy on August 20, opened up about her diet which she followed during her pregnancy days. She stated that "it's a myth when people say eat for two". "Please be sensible while eating if you are carrying a single baby. You need only 350 calories more," Sonam added.

119.title: Jawaharlal Nehru didn't act in 'desh hith' on Kashmir issue: Rijiju
119.article_body: India's first PM, Jawaharlal Nehru, didn't act in "desh hith" (country's interests) when it came to Kashmir, said Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju. "There was no question of plebiscite or taking views of people or any other organisations. Why did Nehru ji make a departure for Kashmir?" he asked, adding that Hari Singh's views were not accepted.

120.title: Mumbai's air quality drops to 'poor' category, AQI rises to 221
120.article_body: Mumbai's air quality slipped from 'moderate' to 'poor' quality on Monday, with the AQI rising to 221, as per the data released by the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research (SAFAR). The overall AQI was 152 (moderate) on Saturday and it was 159 (moderate) on Sunday. Areas, including Andheri and Malad, too reported 'poor' AQI.

121.title: We need intimacy coordinators, people do get exploited: Radhika Apte
121.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has said that she never had an intimacy coordinator, however, added that they "absolutely need it". "People do get exploited...people who exploit, don't necessarily do it with the intention either," she stated. Radhika recalled an instance when she agreed to do something after coming under pressure, however, her agents said, "This is not okay."

122.title: 'Brahmastra 2' will be juicier & more clash oriented: Ayan Mukerji
122.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has said that 'Brahmastra Part Two: Dev' will be "a lot more dramatic and juicier and a lot more clash oriented" than the first film. "I think that part two will just be more of everything, you know, more scale, more VFX, more Astras, more drama modules," Ayan added. 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' featured Ranbir Kapoor.

123.title: Crypto.com sends Ethereum worth $400 mn to another exchange by accident
123.article_body: Crypto.com CEO Kris Marszalek said that the company mistakenly sent over $400 million in Ethereum to another crypto exchange called Gate.io. He said, "It was supposed to be a move to a new cold storage address, but was sent to a whitelisted external exchange address. We worked with Gate team and the funds were subsequently returned to our cold storage."

124.title: Forced religious conversion a serious issue, may affect national security: SC
124.article_body: Forced religious conversion is a "very serious issue" and a "very difficult situation" will emerge if such conversions are not stopped, the Supreme Court observed on Monday. Religious conversions may ultimately affect the security of the nation and the freedom of religion and conscience of citizens, it added. It asked the Centre to make its stand clear on the issue.

125.title: Zelenskyy visits Kherson following the city's recapture from Russia
125.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday visited the southern city of Kherson following its recapture from Russian forces last week. Ukrainians, with their national flags, gathered in front of the administration building in the city's main square where Zelenskyy addressed his troops. He also thanked NATO and other allies for aiding Ukraine in ramping up its war efforts against Russia.

126.title: India need separate teams for different formats of cricket: Kumble
126.article_body: Former Indian skipper Anil Kumble said that India need separate teams for different formats of cricket. "You need, certainly, T20 specialists. I think what this English team...and...Australia have shown is that you need to invest in a lot of allrounders," Kumble said. He added, "No other team [apart from England] has a No. 7 of the quality of Liam Livingstone."

127.title: India's retail inflation declines to a 3-month low of 6.77% in October
127.article_body: India's retail inflation rate fell to a three-month low of 6.77% in October from 7.41% in September, data released by the government showed on Monday. Inflation in rural areas in October 2022 cooled to 6.98%, while that in urban areas softened to 6.50%. Meanwhile, wholesale inflation dipped to 8.39% in October, the lowest since March 2021.

128.title: EU agrees on introducing new sanctions over Iran's protest crackdown
128.article_body: All 27 foreign ministers of EU member states on Monday agreed on the introduction of a new sanctions regime against Iran for its allegedly violent clampdown on the ongoing anti-government protests in the country. The sanctions will target 32 individuals and organisations, including the "inner circle" of the Revolutionary Guard, responsible for the crackdown that has reportedly left hundreds dead.

129.title: 4 men hang dog with chain in Ghaziabad, booked after video surfaces
129.article_body: The Ghaziabad Police booked four men for allegedly hanging their pet dog with a chain after a purported video of the incident went viral. The accused can be seen hanging the dog with a chain and pulling a rope tied to its neck in the video. "Strict legal action will be taken against the accused," said Iraj Raja, SP (rural).

130.title: Man who chopped his live-in partner's body into 35 pieces in Delhi sent to 5-day custody
130.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent Aftab Ameen Poonawalla to five-day police custody for murdering his 26-year-old live-in partner Shraddha. The accused allegedly chopped her body into 35 pieces and dumped them at different locations in Delhi. Shraddha had met Aftab through a dating app when she was working at a call centre in Mumbai, police said.

131.title: 2018 champion PV Sindhu pulls out of BWF World Tour Finals
131.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu has withdrawn from the season-ending BWF World Tour Finals as she has not fully recovered from a stress fracture on her left ankle. The tournament is scheduled to begin on December 14 in Guangzhou, China. The 2018 champion had sustained the injury en route to her gold medal win at Commonwealth Games in August.

132.title: Filmmaker Guneet Monga to tie the knot with entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor in Dec
132.article_body: Filmmaker Guneet Monga is all set to tie the knot with fashion entrepreneur Sunny Kapoor. The couple will get married in Mumbai on December 11 and 12, which will be followed by extended functions in Delhi on December 16. Guneet, who has produced films like 'Gangs of Wasseypur', 'The Lunchbox' and 'Masaan', got engaged to Sunny in April.

133.title: Vir Das postpones shows in Nov, says got ‘huge acting opportunity’
133.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das announced that he's postponing his November shows as he's "gotten a huge acting opportunity". "You'll see me on screen like you've never seen me before," he shared on Twitter. The announcement has come after his shows in Hyderabad and Bengaluru got cancelled amid protests by right-wing organisations, who accused him of making 'anti-India' comments.

134.title: Hrithik Roshan to begin shooting for 'Fighter' in Assam on Nov 18: Report
134.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film 'Fighter' in Assam on November 18. "The leading man will be joined by co-stars Deepika Padukone and Anil Kapoor directly at the air force station that has been chosen as the site of the shoot," a source close to the development stated. 'Fighter' will be directed by Siddharth Anand.

135.title: 7 yrs after woman's suicide, Delhi court convicts in-laws for dowry death
135.article_body: A Delhi court convicted the parents-in-law and the husband of a woman, who died by suicide within 23 days of marriage in 2015, of causing her death for dowry and subjecting her to cruelty. The deceased's elder sister was a crucial witness to whom she revealed the conduct of the accused and how she was subjected to harassment and cruelty.

136.title: 3 govt officials dead after vehicle plunges into gorge in J&K’s Doda
136.article_body: Three government officials died while one other was critically injured in J&K’s Doda when their vehicle skidded off a road and plunged into a deep gorge on Monday, police said. LG Manoj Sinha expressed grief over the accident and directed the district administration to provide all possible assistance to the injured. The vehicle rolled down 200 meters into the gorge.

137.title: Top seed Nadal loses to Fritz, Ruud beats Auger-Aliassime at ATP Finals
137.article_body: Eighth-seeded Taylor Fritz defeated top-seeded Rafael Nadal 7-6(7-3), 6-1 in round-robin stage to make a winning debut at ATP Finals in Turin on Sunday. Earlier, Norway's Casper Ruud beat Canadian Felix Auger-Aliassime 7-6(7-4), 6-4 in his first match of Green Group. Notably, Nadal has never won the ATP Finals title in 10 attempts. He finished runner-up in 2010 and 2013.

138.title: Sensitive info on excise policy leaked: AAP leader tells Delhi HC
138.article_body: AAP's communication in-charge, Vijay Nair, has approached the Delhi HC, alleging that sensitive information pertaining to the excise policy case is being leaked to the media by probe agencies. The HC has asked both CBI and ED to share press communication documents, which have been officially released. ED took Nair into custody on Monday.

139.title: Fintech startup Lentra raises $60 million in Series B round
139.article_body: Fintech cloud lending startup Lentra has raised $60 million in its Series B funding round led by existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners and SIG Venture Capital. The round also saw participation from Citi Ventures. Founded in 2018 by D Venkatesh and Ankur Handa, Lentra offers third-party API connectors to various data sources that banks want to join.

140.title: Dream big, dream for new and developed India: President Droupadi Murmu
140.article_body: Speaking to students at the Rashtrapati Bhavan on Children's Day, President Droupadi Murmu asked all the children to dream big and dream for a new and developed India. "This is a new era of technological and information revolution. Children are now aware about various domestic, social and environmental issues....knowledge and information are now at their fingertips," said Murmu.

141.title: Port Blair-based businessman held in Haryana in gang rape case
141.article_body: A Port Blair-based businessman, carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh, was arrested by Andaman and Nicobar Police from Haryana in connection with a gang rape case, an officer said. "Police got tip-off...through his bank transactions which he made from Haryana. Andaman and Nicobar Police alerted its Haryana and Delhi counterparts and managed to arrest him," the officer stated.

142.title: Tata starts process to bring all airlines under Air India: Report
142.article_body: Tata Sons has reportedly started the process to bring all its airlines, Vistara, AirAsia India and Air India Express, under Air India. Tata Sons has started this process after holding several rounds of discussions with Singapore Airlines, its joint venture partner in Vistara. Through this consolidation, Tata Sons will have a low-cost carrier and a full-service airline under Air India.

143.title: Jet Airways postpones assets' sale due to impasse over resolution plan: Report
143.article_body: Jet Airways has reportedly postponed its plan to monetise its assets due to a deadlock between the Jalan-Kalrock consortium and the lenders over the outline of its resolution plan. The assets include 11 aircraft and aircraft engine spares. NCLAT had ordered the Jalan-Kalrock consortium to pay ₹275 crore as the unpaid provident fund and gratuity dues of eligible employees.

144.title: Piramal, Bain-backed IndiaRF acquire majority stake in Impresario
144.article_body: India Resurgence Fund (IndiaRF), an investment platform backed by Piramal Enterprises and Bain Capital, announced investing ₹550 crore in food and beverage firm Impresario Entertainment and Hospitality. With the transaction, IndiaRF has become the majority shareholder of Impresario. According to an official release, the fresh capital will help fuel the further expansion of Impresario's business.

145.title: Tihar Jail Superintendent suspended over VIP treatment to Satyendar Jain
145.article_body: Tihar Jail Superintendent Ajit Kumar was suspended on Monday over alleged VIP treatment given to AAP minister Satyendar Jain. "He has prima facie been found to have committed irregularities that warrant an inquiry," the Prison Department of the Delhi government said. Earlier, ED claimed that Jain abused his power in jail and was provided with freshly cut fruits and massage.

146.title: Cricket Australia name their Team of T20 World Cup 2022
146.article_body: Cricket Australia have named their Team of T20 World Cup 2022, which comprises three England players, two Pakistan players, two India players and one player each from Bangladesh, New Zealand, South Africa and Zimbabwe. Jos Buttler has been included as captain, wicketkeeper and opener. The team also includes Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Mustafizur Rahman, Sikandar Raza and Anrich Nortje.

147.title: 3 dead after student opens fire at University of Virginia in US
147.article_body: Three people were killed and two were injured in a shooting at the University of Virginia, the university's President Jim Ryan said. A search operation has been launched to nab the suspect, identified as Christopher Darnell Jones, the police department said. Ryan added the suspect is a student and was seen wearing a burgundy jacket, blue jeans and red shoes.

148.title: We were ready to give up 'Chak De!' because of pressure: Salim-Sulaiman
148.article_body: Music composers Salim Merchant and Sulaiman Merchant shared their experience of composing music for 'Chak De! India'. While Salim said that the pressure to compose its music was "crazy", Sulaiman added they were "ready to give up the film" as they were "unable to crack title song". Salim said they took reference from 'Jumma Chumma...' to create the title track.

149.title: Congress becomes unhappy at the sight of saffron: K'taka CM Bommai
149.article_body: After Congress objected to the Karnataka government’s decision to paint classrooms in saffron, CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the Opposition party becomes unhappy at the sight of saffron. "The new classrooms are named after Swami Vivekananda, who was a monk. Hence, the architect suggested saffron...it doesn't have any political intentions," said Bommai.

150.title: Govt unblocks VLC Media Player website within a month of being served legal notice
150.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has unblocked VLC Media Player website within a month of being served a legal notice. In the notice, VideoLAN had demanded a copy of the blocking order and an opportunity to defend its case through virtual hearing. No explanation was reportedly provided by the government with regard to why the URL was blocked.

151.title: Aftab ordered food after killing Shraddha, was 'inspired' by US show 'Dexter'
151.article_body: Aftab Poonawalla, who allegedly killed his live-in partner Shraddha in Delhi, stayed in the house where the murder was committed to avoid suspicion, police said. He ordered food online after the murder and was "inspired" by the American crime drama 'Dexter', investigators added. Aftab hid Shraddha's dismembered corpse in a fridge and lit incense sticks (agarbattis) to hide the stench.

152.title: She wants to follow path of PM Modi: Jadeja on wife's candidature
152.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja, during a BJP event in Gujarat, said that his wife Rivaba Jadeja is first time contesting as an MLA candidate and she'll learn a lot. "I hope she will progress…She..has always wanted to help people and hence joined politics. She wants to follow the path of PM Modi to work for the people," Jadeja added.

153.title: 4 extort money from youngsters on gay dating app in Delhi; arrested
153.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested four men, who allegedly extorted money from youngsters on a gay dating app by threatening to post their intimate videos on social media. A 20-year-old, in his complaint, said that one of the accused took him to a room and the other accused started making a video when he got undressed, said DCP (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram.

154.title: 'Black...' collects ₹50 cr in India on opening weekend, 'Uunchai' earns ₹10 cr
154.article_body: Marvel Studios' 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever' has earned over ₹50 crore in India within three days of its release. Meanwhile, Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai' earned over ₹10 crore on the opening weekend at the domestic box office. 'Uunchai', which was released on limited screens, stars Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher, Boman Irani and Neena Gupta, among others.

155.title: Suniel Shetty to join Anurag Kashyap-starrer 'File No 323': Report
155.article_body: Suniel Shetty has reportedly joined 'File No 323' and will play Vijay Mallya's Chartered Accountant in the Karthik K directorial. The film will feature Anurag Kashyap as Vijay Mallya. "The team will also focus on the economic offences done by Mehul Choksi and Nirav Modi," a source told Pinkvilla. Reportedly, Suniel will join the film's shooting from November 21 onwards.

156.title: Hong Kong protest song replaces China anthem at rugby match in S Korea
156.article_body: A song embraced by Hong Kong pro-democracy protesters was played instead of China's national anthem before the final match, between South Korea and Hong Kong, of the Asia Rugby Sevens Series's second leg on Sunday. On Monday, the tournament's South Korean organisers apologised and said the wrong song was played because of a human error and was not politically motivated.

157.title: 9 including POCSO Act survivors go missing from Kerala shelter home
157.article_body: Nine inmates, including POCSO Act survivors, have gone missing from a shelter home in Kerala on Monday, police said. "The girls were protesting for...past few days saying they wanted to leave...shelter home," a senior police official said. The inmates were provided accommodation at the shelter home, which is run by a private NGO, upon the CWC's direction, police added.

158.title: Some sit in Bengal and tell Delhi not to give money to our state: Mamata
158.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that some people are sitting and eating in Bengal and conspiring and telling Delhi not to give money to Bengal. "I don't need Delhi's money. Bengal is capable of standing on its own feet. Our self-esteem is of utmost importance to us, we wouldn't let Delhi snatch it," she added.

159.title: Retired Army man shoots at woman, then kills self in Haryana
159.article_body: A retired Army man allegedly shot at a woman and then died by suicide in Haryana's Rohtak on Sunday, police said. The man and woman were known to each other and used to stay in the same colony, according to police. The SHO said that both of their families are being contacted and added, "We're probing why...man reached...woman's house."

160.title: Still confident that this group can lift WC: Hayden to Pak after T20 WC loss
160.article_body: Following Pakistan's loss against England in T20 World Cup 2022 final, Pakistan team mentor Matthew Hayden said he's confident that "this group of young men can lift the World Cup". He added, "And I'm confident that we also have some clarity on how to move forward from this tournament. How to celebrate some great performances and...acknowledge some of the weaknesses."

161.title: UP government issues advisory for school students amid dengue outbreak
161.article_body: As dengue cases are on the rise in UP, the government issued an advisory to all schools, instructing them to ensure that all the students wear full sleeve shirts and trousers. It also asked them to avoid keeping clutter on the school's premises. Earlier, the government had cancelled the leaves of all doctors and paramedical staff.

162.title: Sonia pays floral tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on birth anniversary
162.article_body: Congress leader Sonia Gandhi and party President Mallikarjun Kharge paid a floral tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru in Delhi on Monday, on the occasion of the former PM's birth anniversary. Kharge called India's first PM the "maker of modern India". "He was a humanist-secularist who sought national development on all fronts, including agriculture and science," Congress said in a tweet.

163.title: Video shows firing on street near Mumbai amid fight between 2 groups
163.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing firing on a street in Ambarnath near Mumbai amid a fight between two groups. "There was a bullock cart race organised on Sunday morning between two groups. By evening the two groups indulged in some fight which was followed by open firing," police said. Though no one was injured, a car's windshield was damaged.

164.title: Aamir to have cameo in 'Salaam Venky', reunites with Kajol after 16 yrs
164.article_body: The trailer of 'Salaam Venky' showed a glimpse of Aamir Khan hinting at his cameo appearance in the film, which stars Kajol in the lead role. The film will mark Kajol and Aamir's first on-screen appearance in 16 years after their film 'Fanaa', which released in 2006. 'Salaam Venky', which was previously titled 'The Last Hurrah', is directed by Revathy.

165.title: Bomb threat forces London-bound flight to land in Germany
165.article_body: A passenger plane en route to London carrying 206 people was forced to land in the western German city of Paderborn on Sunday night following a bomb threat. No suspicious objects were found during the search of the Airbus A321 operated by a Hungarian airline, police said. The deboarded passengers and crew members were accommodated in hotels for the night.

166.title: Look at kind of films H'wood are bringing: Akshay on B'wood not doing well
166.article_body: Speaking about the poor performances of Bollywood films, actor Akshay Kumar has said, "Look at Hollywood, what kind of movies they are bringing." He added that people come together to watch Marvel films. "The audience wants a story and much more. They don't want to just give their money, they want value for it," he further added.

167.title: Conspiracy being hatched against Bengal, TMC getting defamed: Mamata
167.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said a conspiracy is being hatched against the state and the TMC is being defamed as a part of the exercise. "If a person has committed any mistake, one should be given a chance to rectify those mistakes. If someone got involved in any wrongdoing, the law will take its own course," CM Banerjee added.

168.title: HC rejects plea challenging parole to rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim
168.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court rejected a plea challenging the Dera Sacha Sauda chief and rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim's parole. The petition stated that by allowing Ram Rahim to hold 'satsang', the government is virtually bowing before a rape and murder convict and treating him in a manner as if he is above the law of the land.

169.title: Airplane bought by Hyd’s Pista House gets stuck at underpass; video surfaces
169.article_body: An old airplane that was bought by Hyderabad’s Pista House owner at a Kerala auction got stuck at an underpass in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. It was being transported by road from Kochi to Hyderabad. Huge crowd reached the spot to have a glimpse of the plane. Police reached the spot and made an arrangement to pull out the plane.

170.title: Thought I'm being too toxic: Raj on 'Dear Comrade' scene where he hits Rashmika
170.article_body: Actor Raj Arjun, who played a negative role in Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's 'Dear Comrade', opened up about the film's scene where he had to hit Rashmika's character. "I'd sympathised with her during the shoot and I thought I'm being too toxic," Raj stated. Speaking about Rashmika, Raj said that the actress is "very humble" and a "lovely soul".

171.title: Aftab & Shraddha had eloped to Delhi as her family disapproved of relationship
171.article_body: Aftab Ameen Poonawalla, who allegedly killed his live-in partner Shraddha and chopped her body into 35 pieces in Delhi, had met Shraddha in Mumbai, police said. The two fell in love while working in Mumbai and had eloped to Delhi as her family disapproved of their relationship, they added. He allegedly killed her when she started pressuring him for marriage.

172.title: Big actors are coming on OTT as we need jobs: KGF 2's Prakash Raj
172.article_body: Actor Prakash Raj, who featured in films like 'KGF: Chapter 2' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', has said that big actors are coming on OTT platforms because they need jobs. "Today, big actors who are coming to OTT also have to realise that just because you are a big actor, posters might work but people are noticing content," he added.

173.title: Shardul Thakur, 2 other players traded to KKR ahead of IPL 2023
173.article_body: Bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur has been traded from Delhi Capitals (DC) to Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) ahead of IPL 2023. KKR have acquired Shardul in an all-cash deal. Shardul was bought by DC for ₹10.75 crore in the mega auction earlier this year. Further, Lockie Ferguson and Rahmanullah Gurbaz have been traded from Gujarat Titans (GT) to KKR.

174.title: 62-year-old woman tricked into giving her gold ornament in Pune
174.article_body: A 62-year-old woman on her way to buy vegetables was tricked, by two unidentified persons, into giving away her gold ornament in Pune's Onkar Colony area. They allegedly said they were gifting sarees to elderly women. They said she'll have to take off her gold mangalsutra and put it in a pouch. Later, they stole the pouch and escaped.

175.title: Ajay's Drishyam 2's advance booking surpasses Thank God & Runway 34
175.article_body: Ajay Devgn and Tabu-starrer 'Drishyam 2' has reportedly sold over 35,000 tickets at three national chains through advance booking.
