General Pande will also lay a wreath at the Neuve-Chapelle Indian Memorial, which commemorates the sacrifices of 4,742 Indian soldiers during World War 1.

351.title: List of most polluted cities in India today released
351.article_body: As per the Central Pollution Control Board's latest data, Bihar's Motihari is the most polluted city in India today, with an AQI of 413. It's followed by Purnia (378), Bettiah (377), Siwan (372), Araria (340), Katihar (337), Saharsa (322), Samastipur (317), Darbhanga (316),  Buxar (313), Hisar (311), Fatehabad (306), Delhi (303) and Singrauli (302). Only Motihari is in 'severe' category.

352.title: Video shows the moment explosion occurred at Istanbul's busy pedestrian street
352.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media showing the moment when an explosion occurred on Istanbul's popular pedestrian street, Istiklal Avenue, that left people dead and injured. The video showed flames erupting and a loud bang, as pedestrians turned and ran away. Other footage showed ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene of the explosion.

353.title: 42, including 25 students, injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K
353.article_body: As many as 25 students were among the 42 passengers injured in a road accident in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district. The driver lost control of the vehicle and it fell into the roadside gorge. The injured persons were evacuated to a nearby hospital and five of them were later shifted to GMC Jammu for advanced treatment, officials said.

354.title: Siddhaanth's wife shares their first-ever pic together after actor's death, pens note
354.article_body: Alesia Raut, the wife of actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi who passed away at 46 while working out at a gym, took to Instagram on Sunday to share their first picture together from 2017. Raut wrote, "I love you and always will love you till I am alive." She added, "I know you will be always guiding me as an angel."

355.title: Curran 1st cricketer to win Player of the Final, Player of the Tournament awards in a T20 WC
355.article_body: England pacer Sam Curran on Sunday created history by becoming the first cricketer to win Player of the Final and Player of the Tournament in a single edition of T20 World Cup. Curran bagged Player of the Final award after taking three wickets against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 final. He bagged the tournament award for taking 13 wickets.

356.title: J&K is victim of Centre's wrong policies: Cong leader Ghulam Mir
356.article_body: Congress leader Ghulam Ahmad Mir said that Jammu and Kashmir is a victim of the Centre's "wrong policies". "Only Congress is capable enough to defeat the divisive and anti-people policies of the BJP," Mir said. He added, "The tall claims about the development of J&K, fake narrative built up...[is] reflecting the absolute failures...of the BJP government on all fronts."

357.title: Explosion occurs on busy pedestrian street in Istanbul, several injured
357.article_body: An explosion took place on a busy pedestrian street in Turkey's Istanbul, with several people reported to be injured. A video has surfaced online showing ambulances, fire trucks and police at the scene in Istiklal Avenue. The video also showed flames erupting, with pedestrians running away. The cause of the explosion is not yet clear.

358.title: Rapid growth of urbanisation not matched by urban infra development: RBI
358.article_body: In a report on Municipal Finances, RBI said that the rapid growth of urbanisation in India has not been accompanied by a corresponding increase in urban infrastructure. It said, "[This] is reflected in the performance of the urban local bodies, especially municipal corporations (MCs)." "MCs' committed expenditure in the form of establishment expenses...but capital expenditure is minimal," it said.

359.title: Not possible: Rajiv Gandhi assassination convict Nalini on meeting Gandhis
359.article_body: After her release from prison on Saturday, Nalini Sriharan, a convict in former PM Rajiv Gandhi's assassination, said that it wasn't possible to meet the Gandhi family. Furthermore, she said that she felt "very sorry" when asked about her message for the Gandhis and the families of those who were killed. "They have lost their dear ones," Nalini said.

360.title: 11 charged over killing of Iranian militia member during unrest
360.article_body: Eleven people, including one woman, have been indicted over the killing of a Basij militia force member during anti-hijab protests in Iran, state media reported on Saturday. Among those indicted, some were charged with "corruption on earth", which carries the death penalty. The activist HRANA news agency said 336 protesters had been killed in the unrest as of Friday.

361.title: Sister's kidney was best match: Tejashwi on transplant for father Lalu
361.article_body: Ailing RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav, while talking about his sister's decision of donating a kidney to their father, on Sunday said, "My sister's (Rohini Acharya) kidney turned out to be the best match." "The doctors wanted someone from the family to donate a kidney to my father," Tejashwi added.

362.title: Raveena shares old pics with Juhi on latter's birthday, pens note
362.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon took to Instagram on Sunday to wish Juhi Chawla on the occasion of her 55th birthday. Sharing a series of old pictures with Juhi, she wrote, "Happy birthday my darling Ju." "May your infectious laughter, lighten up our days always! Many many years of love and happiness," Raveena added.

363.title: WB couple, child lodged in jail on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators
363.article_body: A West Bengal couple, along with their one-and-a-half-year-old child, has been reportedly lodged in a Bengaluru jail for over three months on suspicion of being Bangladeshi infiltrators. The couple got employment at a waste segregation unit in Karnataka's Sulibele village, their relatives said. But they were arrested within a month, they added.

364.title: All Pak pacers can bowl 140 plus, bowling attack better than India: Jaffer
364.article_body: Former Indian batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Pakistani bowling attack is better than the Indian attack. "[In] the fast bowling, they have got Shaheen Shah Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah and they all bowl 140 plus. Rauf can easily touch 150 and he is bowling really well," Jaffer said. He added, "[Indian] bowling looks weaker than our batting."

365.title: When I got my first paycheck, I bought groceries for the house: Rajkummar
365.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has revealed that his first paycheck was ₹300, which he got when he was in the eighth standard. He added that he used to give dance tuitions to a girl at her house. "When I earned my first ₹300, I went to buy groceries for...house. And I bought small quantities of everything," Rajkummar said.

366.title: Electricity supply to be cut if consumers don't pay bills for 3 months: BESCOM
366.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) on Friday said that if a consumer does not pay the electricity bill for three consecutive months, action will be initiated to cancel the electricity supply contract. The consumer will then have to apply for a new electricity connection, BESCOM added. Meanwhile, BESCOM has asked consumers to not pay their bills online this month.

367.title: China's daily COVID-19 cases cross 14,000
367.article_body: Coronavirus cases are rising in China as the daily case count on Saturday rose to 14,288, up from a nationwide tally of 11,323 on Friday. China's daily COVID-19 cases have stayed above 10,000 since breaching that level last week for the first time since April. Guangdong, Henan, Beijing, Chongqing and Inner Mongolia remain the places with the most COVID-19 outbreaks.

368.title: Banned PFI's absconding student wing leader arrested in Bengaluru
368.article_body: A leader of the student wing of banned Popular Front of India (PFI) was arrested in Bengaluru on Friday night and taken to Guwahati on Sunday, police said. The absconding leader, Amir Hamza, was hiding with some families from Tripura. A search operation was conducted at Hamza's residence and incriminating documents and posters against BJP, RSS and ABVP were recovered.

369.title: BBMP proposes white-topping 39 B'luru roads at a cost of ₹1,449 cr
369.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought approval from the government to white-top 39 more roads, at an estimated cost of ₹1,449 crore, officials said. Among the key roads that will be white-topped are the Outer Ring Road (ORR) from Silk Board to KR Puram, Indiranagar Double Road, Indiranagar 12th Main Road and Kammanahalli Main Road, among others.

370.title: Mumbai passengers won't be fined for not wearing seat belts till Nov 15
370.article_body: After facing criticism for enforcing penalties on motorists without conducting awareness drives, the Mumbai Traffic Police has temporarily paused the seatbelt action, which was to be implemented from November 1. We made people aware of seat belts in the first ten days and now action will be taken against those not wearing them from November 15 onwards.

371.title: Hot air balloon crashes twice in Austrian Alps; 9 injured
371.article_body: A hot air balloon crashed twice in the Austrian Alps on Saturday, injuring nine people, authorities said. The pilot and co-pilot, along with two passengers, reportedly fell off the carriage during a hard landing. Following this, the balloon took off again with its five remaining passengers and landed after the pilot passed instructions for an emergency landing to the passengers.

372.title: Explosion causes cracks on Udaipur railway track, train services suspended
372.article_body: An explosion took place on a newly-opened railway line in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Sunday, hours before the Asarwa-Udaipur express train was supposed to pass, police said. The movement of trains was suspended after officials were alerted by local residents, who spotted cracks on the railway track. "We have found some explosives on the track," a senior police officer said.

373.title: 3 rob passengers in moving bus at knifepoint in Delhi; arrested
373.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing passengers in a moving bus in Delhi's Kalyanpuri area, police said on Saturday. The accused, who were carrying knives and daggers, snatched phones and wallets from all the passengers while the driver was asked to continue on the same route. The accused were identified with the help of technical surveillance, an officer said.

374.title: 2 arrested for taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from saree shop in Thane
374.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly taking away goods worth ₹77 lakh from a saree shop which they ran in partnership with a businessman in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused were arrested from Parbhani with the help of the CCTV footage and intelligence inputs, police said. Several items, including sarees, a computer and a printer, were recovered from the accused.

375.title: Mumbai airport Customs seize 61 kg gold worth ₹32 cr, biggest 1-day seizure
375.article_body: In the biggest one-day seizure, Mumbai airport's Customs officials seized 61 kg of gold worth ₹32 crore in two different cases and arrested seven passengers. In the first case, four passengers were arrested for concealing gold bars in specially designed waist belts with multiple pockets. In the second case, three passengers were arrested with around eight kg of gold.

376.title: Rajnath defends India's G20 logo, says 'Lotus is symbol of India's heritage'
376.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the lotus is not just BJP's logo, but was also declared the national flower in 1950 since it's a symbol of India's heritage. The use of the symbol was criticised by Opposition parties, and Singh said that the row was unnecessary. "Should we forget that the lotus flower is a national symbol?" he asked.

377.title: Sorry brother, it's called karma: Shami to Akhtar as Pakistan lose T20 WC 2022 final
377.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami responded to former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar's tweet wherein he posted a 'broken heart' emoji following Pakistan's defeat in T20 World Cup 2022 final against England. "Sorry brother...It is called karma," Shami wrote. Earlier, Akhtar had mocked India for not taking a single wicket in their semi-final match against England.

378.title: India International Trade Fair to begin tomorrow in Delhi
378.article_body: The 41st edition of the annual India International Trade Fair will begin on Monday at Delhi's Pragati Maidan. Over 2,000 exhibitors will participate in the "Vocal for Local, Local to Global" themed 14-day fair. While the event is reserved for business visitors from November 14-18, it will open for general public from November 19-27 from 10 am to 7:30 pm.

379.title: Shadab Khan breaks record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket
379.article_body: Leg-spinner Shadab Khan on Sunday broke the record for taking most wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket. With his one wicket in the T20 World Cup 2022 final against England, Shadab took his tally of wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket to 98. He overtook Shahid Afridi, who took 97 wickets for Pakistan in T20I cricket.

380.title: Man sets shop, vehicles on fire in Gurugram for being kicked out of Satsang
380.article_body: A man was booked for allegedly torching a furniture shop and two vehicles in New Basti in Gurugram's Sector 8. The incident happened after the accused, Harish, was slapped and kicked out of a Satsang (religious gathering) for arriving there in an inebriated state, police said. Notably, the furniture shop was owned by the organiser of the Satsang, Parmeshwar Kumar.

381.title: Factory worker dies after colleague pumps air into rectum for fun in UP
381.article_body: A 47-year-old factory worker died after his colleague allegedly inserted an air compressor pipe into his rectum 'for fun' in UP's Kanpur on Friday. The deceased fell unconscious after the pipe, which is used to clean dust, was inserted into his rectum. Rania Police Station in-charge Atul Gautam said that the victim died of excessive internal bleeding.

382.title: Siddhaanth & I stopped talking, I regret not calling him: Neha Marda after actor's death
382.article_body: Days after television actor Siddhaanth Vir Surryavanshi passed away at 46 while working out at the gym, his co-star Neha Marda told ETimes, "I am feeling so bad that after we had a disagreement over something, we stopped talking to each other." She added, "Now I regret not calling him. Had I made that call, we would've been friends again."

383.title: England become first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time
383.article_body: England have become the first-ever team to hold both ODI and T20 World Cups at the same time. England, who won the T20 World Cup 2022 today after defeating Pakistan in the final, are also the defending ODI world champions having won ODI World Cup in 2019. England had beaten New Zealand in the 2019 final.

384.title: Ben Stokes smashes fifty in T20I cricket for the first time ever
384.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes on Sunday smashed his T20I career's first-ever fifty. The 31-year-old scored an unbeaten 52 off 49 deliveries to help his team defeat Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final. Stokes hit five fours and a six in his knock. His previous highest score in T20I cricket was 47*(30), which came against South Africa in 2020.

385.title: Who is Nishad Singh, a core team member of the now-bankrupt FTX?
385.article_body: Nishad Singh worked as the Director of Engineering at FTX, the US crypto exchange that filed for bankruptcy. He was reportedly a part of FTX's 30-year-old Founder Sam Bankman-Fried's inner circle that lived in a luxury penthouse in the Bahamas. Singh, who previously worked at Facebook, Alameda Research and Berkeley Consulting, did his BSc from the University of California, Berkeley.

386.title: No actor wanted to work with us during 'Maine Pyar...': Sooraj Barjatya
386.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya revealed that no actor wanted to work with his company Rajshri Productions while he was making 'Maine Pyar Kiya'. "Our last few films were a flop...we were suffering financially...one day, I met a young man who we'd rejected after his first screen test. But there was something about him...That man was Salman Khan," he added.

387.title: West trying to militarise Southeast Asia: Russian Foreign Minister
387.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Sunday accused the West of seeking to militarise Southeast Asia in a bid to contain Russian and Chinese interests. This comes ahead of the Bali G20 summit of state leaders where the Russian delegation led by Lavrov will come face-to-face with Western leaders, the first such meeting since the beginning of the Ukraine war.

388.title: Serial liar, says BJP on Rahul's privatisation of 150 railway stations remark
388.article_body: Press Information Bureau (PIB) fact-checked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's claims that the Central government has privatised over 150 railway stations in the country and called the claims "completely bogus". Responding to the development, BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla said, "Rahul Gandhi is a serial liar and this is not the first time that he has been caught with his lies."

389.title: England defeat Pakistan to win T20 World Cup after 12 years, equal West Indies' record
389.article_body: England defeated Pakistan by five wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022 final in Melbourne to win T20 World Cup after 12 years. England restricted Pakistan to 137/8 in 20 overs and went on to chase down the target in 19 overs. With this, England have equalled West Indies' record for winning most T20 World Cup titles (two).

390.title: Varun is the most enthusiastic person I've ever met: 'Bhediya' director
390.article_body: 'Bhediya' director Amar Kaushik said in an interview that actor Varun Dhawan is the most curious and enthusiastic person he has ever met. "Not just in the industry, but in my entire life. He's the first person to call me every morning...He'll constantly ask questions about his character, like - 'Can we do this, can we do that'," Amar added.

391.title: Manjima Mohan-Gautham Karthik to get married on Nov 28: Report
391.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik, who made their relationship official on October 31 via an Instagram post, are reportedly getting married on November 28 this year. The wedding will reportedly take place in Chennai. As per a report, the couple will also host a reception in Ooty and Chennai for their friends and colleagues after the wedding.

392.title: Dimple Yadav to file nomination for Mainpuri bypolls tomorrow: Report
392.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav is likely to file her nomination papers for Mainpuri bypolls on Monday, senior party leader Alok Shakya said. The Mainpuri bypolls will be held on December 5 and the result will be declared on December 8. Notably, Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat fell vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav in October.

393.title: 3 people rob 18-year-old of jewellery worth ₹18 lakh in Mumbai, booked
393.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly stealing diamond jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from an 18-year-old man in Mumbai. They posed as priests and asked the victim to buy flowers for puja. When he ignored them, one of them asked him to make five rounds on that path as a punishment. They then ran away with the jewellery.

394.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' revealed real identity of Rahul Gandhi: Kanhaiya Kumar
394.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar hailed the party's "Bharat Jodo Yatra" and said that the march revealed the real identity of MP Rahul Gandhi. "Women are also meeting Rahul Gandhi comfortably during the yatra…The first leg of [yatra] has been completed and the second stage of the journey will be based on the unfulfilled promises of the BJP government," said Kanhaiya.

395.title: Robbers open fire and loot ₹25 lakh from courier office in Pune
395.article_body: A gang of robbers opened fire and looted ₹25 lakh from a courier office in Pune's Market Yard area on Saturday, the police said. CCTV footage showed that five men barged into the office and one of them broke the building's glass exterior and fired a round in the ground. "We have formed teams to trace them," an official said.

396.title: 'Metaverse' theme park to be built near 'Statue of Prosperity' in Bengaluru
396.article_body: Karnataka minister Ashwath Narayan confirmed that the government is building a new "metaverse" theme park near the "Statue of Prosperity" to attract tourism. "The...park would have tiny lakes, cultural symbols...and 'metaverse' experiences to depict rich heritage and tech prowess...[It] will be integrated with sacred soil and water, collected from various villages of Karnataka," said Narayan.

397.title: Priyanka Gandhi questioned me about her father's killing in jail, cried: Nalini Sriharan
397.article_body: Nalini Sriharan, one of the convicts freed in former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination case on Saturday, said that Priyanka Gandhi Vadra met her in the Vellore Central Prison in 2008 and asked about the killing of her father. "She got emotional for her father. She cried too," said Sriharan. She added that she told Priyanka Gandhi whatever she knew.

398.title: Shehzad Poonawalla shares 'Lootera' poster, says 'How AAP looted Delhi'
398.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's Shehzad Poonawalla took to Twitter to share a poster with Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's picture on a bike. 'Lootera' can be seen written on top of the poster. "How AAP looted Delhi," Poonawalla wrote on Twitter. He also shared the poster at a press conference earlier today.

399.title: Polling party suspended after EVMs found in private vehicle amid Himachal Pradesh polls
399.article_body: A polling party has been suspended after it was allegedly caught transporting Electronic Voting Machines in a private vehicle by Congress workers in Himachal Pradesh's Rampur amid state Assembly elections. "We found...Polling Party No.146 was carrying EVM/VVPAT machine in a private vehicle...and prima facie found the party has not followed due procedures," Returning Officer Surender Mohan said.

400.title: 100% false: Twitter's ex-employee as Musk calls Twitter 'biggest click driver'
400.article_body: A former Twitter employee denied Elon Musk's claim of Twitter driving a massive number of clicks to other websites/apps and being the "biggest click driver on the internet". Claire Diaz-Ortiz, who worked at Twitter for over five years, tweeted, "Lies...This is 100% false & Twitter knows it." She added, "Twitter is much lower on traffic than Facebook and LinkedIn."
